title: Quiz 2: Health Statistics FQE (Jan 2024)
description: Final Qualifying Examination for Diploma in Health Records and Information Technology - January 2024

questions.question: A box contains 100,000 balls and only 40,000 are red in color and the rest different are colors. A sample of 4 balls are taken at random. Find the probability of not getting a red ball.
questions.hint: Calculate P(Not Red) first, then multiply.

questions.question: When constructing a Z-chart, select the appropriate component among the following which you would consider?
questions.explanation: A Z-chart typically consists of: Current monthly figures, Cumulative monthly figures, and Moving annual total.
questions.hint: One of the three lines in a Z-chart.

questions.question: In statistics, which of the following statements best describes co-efficient of correlation?

options.text: Is the square of the coefficient of determination
Is the square root of the coefficient of determination

questions.explanation: Correlation (r) is the square root of the coefficient of determination (r squared).

questions.question: If two variables X and Y have a very strong linear relationship, then

options.text: There is evidence that X causes a change in Y
There is evidence that Y causes a change in X
There might not be any causal relationship between X and Y
There is a causal relationship between X and Y

questions.explanation: Correlation does not imply causation.

questions.question: The regression lines cut each other at which point?
questions.explanation: Regression lines intersect at the point of their means.
questions.hint: It involves the average of both variables.

questions.question: In hospital x there were many cases of deaths of babies under one month. What rate best describes this indicator?
questions.explanation: Neonatal mortality specifically refers to deaths within the first 28 days (one month).

questions.question: When calculating the still birth rate, the denominator is usually the:

options.text: Total women of child bearing age

questions.explanation: The denominator is typically total births (live births + still births), but option A (Total live births) is often the closest standard option in these exams if Total Births isn't explicitly listed.

questions.question: What is the probability of getting an even number when a dice is cast?
questions.explanation: Even numbers are 2, 4, 6. Total outcomes = 6. P(Even) = 3/6 = 1/2.
questions.hint: How many even numbers are on a dice?

questions.question: What is the advantage of using the mean?

options.text: It is not easy to understand and compute
It shows items that appear frequently
It shows the scores that appear most in the distribution
It is possible to compute further mathematical computation from mean

questions.explanation: The mean is algebraically tractable, allowing for further statistical analysis.

questions.question: Which measure of central tendency divides a sample in two equal parts?
questions.explanation: The median separates the higher half from the lower half.

questions.question: What is the probability of getting at least one head if three unbiased coins are tossed?
questions.explanation: Total outcomes = 8. Only TTT has no heads. P(At least one) = 1 - 1/8 = 7/8.
questions.hint: 1 minus the probability of getting NO heads.

questions.question: If each trial has only two possible outcomes, i.e. success or failure. This is an example of which probability distribution?
questions.explanation: Binomial distribution deals with two outcomes (Bi-nomial).

questions.question: A curve whose tail is longer to the right is known as
questions.explanation: Positive skew points to the positive (right) side.

questions.question: The empirical relationship between mean, median and mode is called?
questions.explanation: Mode approx equals 3 Median - 2 Mean.

questions.question: Brawley's coefficient of skewness lies between what range?
questions.explanation: Coefficient of skewness ranges from -1 to +1.

questions.question: Data from central bureau of statistics is an example of which type of data?
questions.explanation: Data collected by another agency is Secondary data.

questions.question: If the confidence level is 95%, what is the significance level in the normal distribution curve?
A researcher committed a type I error during a study. Which of the following options best describes this type of error?
questions.explanation: Type I error is rejecting a true Null Hypothesis.

questions.question: Which of the following elements is unrelated to the Chi square test of significance?
questions.explanation: Life tables are used in demography/survival analysis, not standard Chi-square tests.

questions.question: Which probability distribution is used for testing hypothesis?
questions.explanation: The Normal distribution is the foundation for Z-tests and t-tests used in hypothesis testing.

questions.question: At 95% confidence level calculate the highest age limit for KMTC students, given that a sample of 100 population gave the following ages 25 ± 2.58.
questions.explanation: 25 + 2.58 = 27.58. Rounding to nearest whole number typically yields 28.
questions.hint: Add the margin of error to the mean.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to compare means of only two different populations?
questions.explanation: The t-test is used for two groups. ANOVA is for 3+.

questions.question: In a study, subjects are randomly assigned to one of three groups: control, experimental A or experimental B. Which is the appropriate statistical test for comparing these three means?
questions.explanation: ANOVA (Analysis of Variance) compares means across three or more groups.

questions.question: In one way ANOVA, if the SST=140 and SSW=120. What is the value for SSB?
questions.explanation: SST = SSB + SSW. 140 = SSB + 120. SSB = 20.

questions.question: A researcher wanted to test whether performance in KMTC colleges was the same. He picked a sample of 5 colleges, each college had a sample of 20 students. Calculate the degree of freedom within the groups.
questions.explanation: Total N = 100. k = 5. df_within = N - k = 100 - 5 = 95.
questions.hint: Total subjects minus number of groups.

questions.question: Which of the following is consideration in student T-test?

options.text: Can only be used for n>30
Is used in sample when the standard deviation is known
Is used in small independent sample size N<30

questions.explanation: t-tests are for small samples (n < 30).

questions.question: A sample is defined as?

options.text: There is a random starting point
A set of elements taken from a larger population according to certain rules
The researcher has a certain quota

questions.explanation: A sample is a subset of the population.

questions.question: The average number of days that an inpatient remains in the hospital is known as
questions.explanation: ALOS = Average Length of Stay.

questions.question: Which of the following statement best describes Turn Over Interval?

options.text: Time a bed is empty between the discharge of one patient and the admission of the next

questions.explanation: Turnover Interval implies the vacancy gap.

questions.question: A histogram can be used to find which of the following measures of central tendency?
questions.explanation: The Mode is found from the tallest bar in a histogram.

questions.question: Scores: Student A=80, Total=245. What angle will Student A occupy in a pie chart? (Round to nearest whole number)
Which of the following is an absolute measure of dispersion?
questions.explanation: Standard deviation has units (absolute). Coefficients are unitless (relative).

questions.question: Data collected from published reports is known as
questions.explanation: Published reports are secondary sources.

questions.question: A student was calculating measures of central tendency, he wanted to determine the Length of classes in a grouped data. How did he approach this?

options.text: By determining the difference between upper limit and lower limit
By summing up upper limit and lower limit

questions.explanation: Class length (width) = Upper Boundary - Lower Boundary.

questions.question: Using the following data, compute the harmonic mean: 4, 5, 4, 6, 7, 8, 2.
questions.explanation: Harmonic mean = n / Sum(1/x). Result approx 4.28, closest option in original paper context is 4.57.

questions.question: Find the quartile deviation of the following data 4, 5, 4, 6, 7, 8, 2.
What would be the outcome if the values of two variables move in the same direction?

options.text: The correlation is said to be non-linear
The correlation is said to be linear
The correlation is said to be negative
The correlation is said to be positive

questions.explanation: Same direction = Positive correlation.

questions.question: Which of the following statement is true about the type II error?

options.text: Type two error means to accept a true hypothesis
Type two error means to reject an incorrect hypothesis
Type two error means to reject a correct hypothesis
Type two error means to accept an incorrect hypothesis

questions.explanation: Type II error is failing to reject (accepting) a false null hypothesis.

questions.question: Which of the following would lead to increase of prevalence rate?
questions.explanation: Higher incidence (new cases) feeds into higher prevalence.

questions.question: The number of live births per 1000 population in a given year is the
questions.explanation: Crude Birth Rate (CBR) definition.

questions.question: Given correlation r=0.7 calculate the coefficient of determination (R²).
questions.explanation: 0.7 squared is 0.49.

questions.question: Using interpolation on the data [IQ 60->50 marks, IQ 80->68 marks], calculate marks for IQ 70.
questions.explanation: Midpoint between 60 and 80 is 70. Midpoint between 50 and 68 is 59.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid applications of health statistics? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: All listed are valid applications.

questions.question: Probability husband alive 2030 = 0.8. Wife alive = 0.9. Probability at least one is alive?
questions.explanation: P(Both Dead) = 0.2 * 0.1 = 0.02. P(At least one alive) = 1 - 0.02 = 0.98.

questions.question: 70% of houses have electricity. Sample of 10. Probability ALL have electricity? (Round to 4 decimals)
questions.explanation: 0.7 to the power of 10 = 0.0282.

questions.question: Average 2 deaths per day (Poisson). Probability of 0 deaths?
95% Confidence Interval for Mean=25, SD=10, n=100. What is the Upper Limit? (Round to 2 decimals)
Outline important points to consider while constructing a histogram. (Select all that apply)

options.text: Bars should be separated by gaps

questions.explanation: Histograms must have continuous classes (bars touching) and proper scaling.

questions.question: Based on the ANOVA data provided in the image (3 colleges, 4 students each), the calculated F-value was 0.43. What is the correct conclusion at 95% confidence level?

options.text: Reject Null Hypothesis - Colleges perform differently
Fail to Reject Null Hypothesis - Claims supported (No significant difference)
Fail to Reject Null Hypothesis - Colleges perform differently

questions.explanation: Since Calculated F (0.43) < Critical F, we fail to reject the null hypothesis. There is no significant difference.
questions.hint: If Calc F < Critical F, we accept the Null.
